news.title: Starmer's chief of staff McSweeney not leaving role over briefing war, BBC told
news.summary: The PM's top aide was not involved "directly or indirectly" in briefings against cabinet ministers, sources tell the BBC.

news.title: Missing information and racism concerns: Five key failings in Sara Sharif review
news.summary: Review finds "different actions could and should have been taken" leading up to the 10-year-old's death.

news.title: BBC faces fresh claim of misleading Trump edit
news.summary: The clip aired on Newsnight in 2022, two years before the Panorama that led to the director-general's resignation.

news.title: Police and crime commissioners to be scrapped in England and Wales
news.summary: The government says it will save £100m over this Parliament and less than 20% of voters can name their PCC.

news.title: Amber warnings issued ahead of heavy rain from Storm Claudia
news.summary: Storm Claudia is set to bring heavy and persistent rain to parts of the UK with amber warnings issued with risk of flooding and disruption.

news.title: Faisal Islam: Slow growth raises stakes even higher for the Budget
news.summary: The Budget somehow has to provide certainty, boost consumer and business confidence, and fill a large fiscal gap.

news.title: Titanic passenger's watch expected to fetch £1m
news.summary: The watch belonged to Bavarian-born American businessman Isidor Straus, who died in the disaster.

news.title: Guests ejected mid-stay from bankrupt hotel chain Sonder
news.summary: Sonder guests have complained that they had to leave their accommodation as the firm files for a sudden bankruptcy.

news.title: Royal escort motorcyclist cleared over pedestrian's death
news.summary: Met Police officer PC Christopher Harrison was accused of causing death by careless driving.

news.title: Russia's attacks have ramped up - Ukraine is fighting to hold on through another winter
news.summary: Years of conflict have taken their toll and the war of attrition is continuing on the homefront - but Ukrainians are fighting back hard by trying to keep morale high
